newsitem.title: POLAND: Mostostal-Z sets issue price PLN 9.5-12.
newsitem.headline: Mostostal-Z sets issue price PLN 9.5-12.

text.p: Polish construction company Mostostal Zabrze SA set the issue price of its 2.6-million-share offering between 9.5 and 12 zlotys, the company said in its issue prospectus.
It said the final issue price would be announced two days before its subscription opens on November 12.
Mostostal said Creditanstalt Securities brokerage, which would offer the shares, would arrange a consortium of underwriters and the stand-by fee would be 2.3 percent.
It said the expected 26-30 million zlotys from the issue would be earmarked for investments. @
Mostostal will offer two million shares in the large- investor tranche due from November 12 to 13 in which investors can subscribe for at least 20,005 shares.
In the small-investor tranche from November 12 to November 15 it will offer 600,000 shares. Mostostal plans to use the proceeds from the issue largely to modernise firms in its holding.
Mostostal saw its net profit rising to nine million zlotys in 1996 and to 10.3 million zlotys in 1997, up from last year's net of 6.8 million. @
It expected its sales to rise to 180 million zlotys this year and to 200 million in 1997, up from last year's 142.9 million zlotys.
It expected its group net profit was likely to rise to 11 million zlotys in 1996 and to 14 million zlotys in 1997, up from last year's 6.2 million.
